business.headline: Gold prices continue to rise. Why are they climbing?After months of ups and downs, gold is once again on the rise. With fresh global triggers and growing demand, the metal is gaining strength. Here's a closer look at the factors fuelling the latest surge.

Retail inflation eases to record low of 0.25% in October as food prices fallThe latest consumer price index (CPI) print was well below expectations and marks the lowest reading since the current CPI series began in 2015, which uses 2012 as the base year.

Is your income tax refund delayed? Here's how interest is calculated on itWaiting endlessly for your tax refund can test anyone's patience. The silver lining? The government compensates you with interest for delays — at a fixed rate, calculated monthly. But there are rules, limits and exceptions. Let's decode them.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as US optimism sparks IT rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 595.19 points to close at 84,466.51, while the NSE Nifty50 added 180.85 points to end at 25,875.80.

Gold without the glitter: Why investors are moving away from physical goldIn October 2025, India recorded the third-highest gold ETF inflows globally, behind only the United States and China, a clear sign that the country's love for gold is being redefined in the digital era.

Buying a house just because you can afford the EMI? Think againThe calculator may say you can afford it, but life may say otherwise. A home loan is not just a financial decision — it impacts savings, career choices, and long-term stability.

Explained: Why Adani Enterprises shares have gained over 6% todayAdani Enterprises share price: The rise came after the company announced plans for a Rs 24,930-crore rights issue, its biggest fundraising move since the cancelled follow-on public offering (FPO) in 2023.

IndusInd Bank shares jump 5% today. What's behind the rally?At around 1:20 pm, IndusInd Bank shares were up 4.38% at Rs 862.05 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with trading volumes remaining strong through the afternoon session.

India's direct tax collection up 7%, but refunds down 17.7%. What does it mean?India's direct tax collection climbed 7% this year, but refunds dropped 17.7%. It leaves taxpayers asking what's really driving the change.

Sensex jumps 600 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 663.63 points to 84,534.95, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 196.25 points to 25,891.20 as of 11:38 am. The rally comes after days of sluggish trade.

The great IPO gamble: Why so many retail investors end up losing moneyThis is Part 1 of a three-part series examining how India's IPO boom is entering risky territory for retail investors amid sky-high valuations and growing market hype.

When income rises but wealth doesn't: Inside India's lifestyle inflation problemThe globalisation, liberalisation, and privatisation of the post 1991 – propelled GDP growth but fostered dynamics that entrench lifestyle creep at a seed level.

Groww shares list 12% higher on debut: Hold or book profit now?Groww's market debut at Rs 112 marks a strong start for the fintech, but analysts say investors should book partial profits and hold the rest for long-term growth amid valuation risks.

Groww shares list at 14% premium, exceeds expectation on market debutThe stock opened at Rs 114 on the BSE and Rs 112 on the NSE, compared to its IPO price of Rs 100 per share, exceeding market expectations for a modest gain.

Tata Motors CV shares list at 28% premium after demerger at Rs 335Tata Motors' commercial vehicle arm listed with a strong premium, reflecting investor confidence in India's transport and infrastructure growth, and marking a major milestone in the company's value-unlocking journey.

Pine Labs IPO allotment out: Check status, listing date and expected gainsInvestors who have applied for the IPO can check their allotment status through the BSE website or via the registrar, Kfin Technologies Ltd.

Gold price at Rs 1.24 lakh, silver nears Rs 1.56 lakh: What's next?The rally in precious metals comes amid expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut next month, easing concerns around the prolonged US government shutdown and continued weakness in the dollar index.

Tenneco Clean Air IPO opens for bidding: Check price band, GMP before subscribingTenneco Clean Air IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 3,600 crore, entirely an offer for sale (OFS) of 9.07 crore shares. This means all proceeds will go to the selling shareholders, and the company will not receive any fresh capital from the issue.

Sensex, Nifty open higher on optimism over Bihar exit polls, US trade dealOptimism over a likely NDA victory in Bihar and hopes of an imminent India-US trade deal lifted investor sentiment, driving Sensex and Nifty higher even as caution lingered over FII activity.

Tata Motors CV Listing: Post-demerger details and what it means for investorsThe new entity, Tata Motors Ltd (CV), will be India's largest commercial vehicle manufacturer, with a wide portfolio spanning small cargo vehicles, medium and heavy commercial vehicles (M&HCVs), and buses.

entertainment.headline: Gal Gadot honoured with Israel's Genesis Prize for her wartime activism Gal Gadot was honoured with Israel's Genesis Prize for her wartime support towards her home country. She has been a vocal advocate demanding the release of hostages, ever since the Israel-Hamas conflict escalated.

Aryan Khan is very grounded: The Ba***ds of Bollywood actor Armaan Khera Actor Armaan Khera has shared memorable experiences from his audition for 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. In the exclusive interview, he also opened up about his meeting with Shah Rukh Khan.

Suhana Khan's adorable birthday wish for Aryan is all sibling love, Ananya joins Aryan Khan, son of Shah Rukh and Gauri Khan, marked his 28th birthday on November 12, receiving widespread wishes from sister Suhana Khan and others.

After Twinkle's viral cheating remark, Kajol says marriage should have expiry date In the finale of 'Two Much With Kajol and Twinkle', Kajol sparked a debate by suggesting marriages should have an expiry date and renewal option.

Vikrant Massey's birthday wish for wife Sheetal is about more love, life and babies Actor Vikrant Massey shared a loving birthday message for his wife Sheetal Thakur with a sunset photo. The actor was last seen in 'Aankhon Ki Gustakhiyan' (2025) opposite Shanaya Kapoor.

Shilpa Shetty marks 32 years of Baazigar, shares old-school montage with SRK, Kajol Shilpa Shetty Kundra marked 32 years of 'Baazigar' with a nostalgic montage and a heartfelt post celebrating the film that launched her career. The 1993 thriller, co-starring Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol, remains a timeless Bollywood classic.

Squid Game actor Oh Young-soo acquitted in assault case due to lack of evidence A South Korean court has overturned the indecent assault conviction of 'Squid Game' actor Oh Young-soo. The court cited insufficient evidence in the sexual assault lawsuit against him.

Ram Gopal Varma apologises to child actor for risky scene in Shiva after 36 years Ram Gopal Varma has apologised to child actor Sushma, 36 years after filming a risky stunt in his debut film 'Shiva'. The director admitted his "directorial greed" blinded him to the dangers of the cycle chase scene that featured Nagarjuna and Sushma.

Kriti Sanon recalls Hrithik Roshan's late-night call after Heropanti debut Kriti Sanon recently opened up about receiving a late-night congratulatory call from Hrithik Roshan. She revealed the call came following the release of her debut film 'Heropanti'.

Sudeep praises Simple Suni, calls him one of Kannada cinema's best directors Kichcha Sudeep launched the trailer of Simple Suni's 'Gatha Vaibhava' ahead of its November 14 release, praising the director for his craft and attention to detail.

Prithviraj's SSMB29 poster drives viral helmet awareness campaign of Kerala Police As excitement builds for SS Rajamouli and Mahesh Babu's upcoming film 'SSMB29', Prithviraj Sukumaran's intense first-look poster has gone viral for an unexpected reason as Kerala Police creatively uses it for a road safety campaign.

Huma Qureshi says her role was cut short in Jolly LLB 2: I was really upset Huma Qureshi shared that much of her role in 'Jolly LLB 2' was cut during editing, leaving her feeling upset about the reduced screen time. The actor said she dislikes "ornamental" parts and hopes for more meaningful roles ahead.

23 years of Prabhas: 23 films and countless milestones for the pan-India superstar November 11 marked a poetic full circle for Prabhas, from his 2002 debut film 'Eeswar' to the completion of his upcoming film, 'The Raja Saab'. It has been the journey of a star who turned quiet beginnings into pan-India dominance.

K-pop star Bang Yedam on wanting to visit Taj Mahal, Delhi, Bengaluru, speaks in Hindi | Exclusive South Korean singer-songwriter Bang Yedam, in an exclusive interview with India Today, opened up about his relationship with his fans. The K-pop star, who was in Mumbai to perform at the K-Town Festival, expressed his gratitude towards his fandom and more.

Exclusive: Maxton Hall S2 star Damian Hardung promises to visit India, playing James, spirituality In an exclusive chat with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal, Damian Hardung spoke about playing James this season, why it was tougher than Season 1 and visiting India. He shared that he had visited India before but would like to return and especially visit Rajasthan. Joining in for another conversation was director Martin Schreier, who explained why this season was more about them finding each other as individuals versus enemies-to-lovers trope.

Aryan Khan turns 28: Star kid who made filmmaking cooler than stardom Who needs a grand launch when you can drop a bold debut? Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan, with his grand OTT launch, proved that creativity can be the star, too, when it comes to making an impact. As he turns 28 today, take a look at how Aryan Khan chose to rewrite the rules of a star kid's debut and chart his own creative path.

Govinda discharged from hospital, says yoga works better than heavy workouts Actor Govinda was released from the hospital on Wednesday after fainting at home the previous night. Upon his discharge, Govinda addressed the media and shared his experience, emphasising the benefits of yoga and pranayama over intense workouts.

Tom Felton returns as Draco Malfoy on Broadway Tom Felton debuted as Draco Malfoy in 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child' at New York City's Lyric Theatre, marking his first Broadway appearance and drawing a passionate reaction from fans.

Bigg Boss 19: Shehbaz's girlfriend bashes Farrhana for calling him rhinoceros A recent episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' has drawn attention after contestant Shehbaz Badesha was subjected to body-shaming remarks by housemate Farrhana Bhatt, prompting a public response from his girlfriend Kashish.

general news.headline: Delhi bomber's 2nd car, red EcoSport, found near Haryana village after massive hunt  Live UpdatesRed EcoSport car owned by Delhi blast suspect was found parked in Haryana after cops launched massive hunt this afternoon. The car with DL10CK0458 plate was registered in the name of Umar Un Nabi at Rajouri Garden RTO on 22 November 2017.

Al-Falah University's Dr Hassan, fired by J&K government, missing after Delhi blastDr Nisar-ul-Hassan, a former assistant professor at Srinagar's SMHS Hospital who was dismissed by the Jammu and Kashmir government in 2023 for alleged anti-national activities, has gone missing after Monday's car blast near Delhi's Red Fort that claimed 12 lives.

Bomb scare on Air India Express flight, IndiGo gets security threat for 5 airportsAccording to sources, IndiGo received security-related concerns for five major airports - Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Hyderabad, and Thiruvananthapuram. The security threat was received digitally.

Al-Falah: The Haryana university which employed doctors of terrorAl-Falah University : Since links emerged between the Red Fort blast primary suspect, Dr Umar Nabi, and Al-Falah University, the institution in Faridabad, as well as its recruitment policies, have come under scrutiny.

Thalapathy's goodbye: What Jadeja's exit would mean for Chennai Super KingsIPL 2026 retention: Ravindra Jadeja has been part of CSK's soul. If the trade to Rajasthan Royals materialises, CSK will lose more than a spin-bowling all-rounder. They will lose a symbol of loyalty and big moments. For CSK, Sanju Samson's arrival would be a promise, and a test of reinvention.

2005 Delhi blasts victim's children escape Red Fort explosion by minutes2005 Delhi serial blast victim's children had a narrow escape after their car crossed the Red Fort road minutes before the blast. The siblings were returning from the LIC office in Geeta colony.

Video: Groom stabbed at wedding, cameraman's drone chases attackers for 2 kmA groom was stabbed during his wedding ceremony in Amravati, with the attack caught on drone footage. The drone followed the fleeing attacker for two kilometres, aiding police in their investigation.

OBCs backed NDA; RJD-Cong retained Muslim-Yadav loyalty: Axis My India exit pollThe Axis My India exit poll survey, conducted across 2,154 villages and towns covering all 243 Assembly constituencies, included responses from 42,031 voters.

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.

Retail inflation eases to record low of 0.25% in October as food prices fallThe latest consumer price index (CPI) print was well below expectations and marks the lowest reading since the current CPI series began in 2015, which uses 2012 as the base year.

After Twinkle's viral cheating remark, Kajol says marriage should have expiry dateIn the finale of 'Two Much With Kajol and Twinkle', Kajol sparked a debate by suggesting marriages should have an expiry date and renewal option.

Osama bin Laden's speech found in phone of Pune techie arrested for terror 'links'The Maharashtra ATS found several incriminating materials, including an Urdu translation of a speech delivered by former al-Qaida chief Osama bin Laden in one of the phones of a Pune techie arrested last month for his alleged links with al-Qaida and other banned outfits.

She wanted to go abroad, I wasn't willing: Ex-husband of Jaish-linked Dr ShaheenZafar Hayat, who is also a doctor by profession, said that his marriage to Shaheen ended in 2013 as she wanted to move to Europe, and he wasn't willing to leave India. The couple share two children who live with their father following the divorce.

Can Mayor Mamdani arrest Netanyahu in New York on January 1?Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is set to arrive in in New York on Zohran Mamdani's first day as mayor. The mayor-elect had promised to arrest Netanyahu for "war crimes" in Gaza, but can he really get him arrested? The city is bracing for a clash of global politics and local governance.

The Chanakya paradox: A myth so useful, we made it historyBetween history and legend lies the enigma of Chanakya, a man who may have shaped India's destiny, or never existed at all. But can itihaas and katha not co-exist?

Afghan cricketer Rashid Khan confirms second marriage, 10 months after firstAfghanistan cricket star Rashid Khan, who represents Gujarat Titans in the Indian Premier League (IPL), confirmed that he had married for a second time on August 2, 2025, just 10 months after his first marriage. His confirmation came after rumours sparked by charity event photos. Khan requested his privacy be respected.

Al-Falah University breaks silence as doctors' arrest exposes Delhi blast linksClarifying its position, the university said it had "no connection with the said persons apart from their official duties" and described the reports linking it to the case as "baseless and defamatory".

How Asim Munir is taking Pakistan Army to 7th-century ArabiaPakistani Army Chief Asim Munir is staging a silent coup by getting the Constitution amended. Amid consolidation of power, Munir, a Quran-e-Hafiz, is taking the Pakistani military to 7th-century Arabia by using terms like fitna and khawarij from early Islamic history. The indoctrination is such that the Pakistani military is making its battles a jihad for Islam.

Why the Tata Sierra could spark a "Nexon moment" for the brandTata Motors is set to revive its iconic Sierra SUV on November 25, 2025, blending nostalgic charm with modern technology, design, and versatility. Here's why it could bring the success that the Nexon once did.

Rohit Sharma's Aaj Mere Yaar Ki Shaadi Hai surprise dance for couple goes viralWhile exercising at what appeared to be a hotel gym in Mumbai, Sharma noticed the couple posing for pictures in the garden outside his window. In a heartwarming gesture, he turned up the speakers and played the Bollywood classic Aaj Mere Yaar Ki Shaadi Hai.

Jaish-linked doctors planned to attack Red Fort on Republic Day; plot was foiledHours after police busted the terror module with links to Jaish-e-Mohammed and Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind, and arrested eight people including three doctors, a high-intensity blast ripped through a slow-moving car near Delhi's Red Fort area, killing 12 people and injuring several others.

Live: PM Modi chairs key cabinet meet on security after Delhi blastRed Fort Blast Live Updates: A massive blast ripped through a Hyundai i20 near Gate No. 1 of Delhi's Red Fort Metro Station around 6:50 pm on Monday, killing ten people and leaving several others critically injured. The explosion occurred as the car halted at a red light, and agencies suspect it to be a planned terror attack, invoking the UAPA in the FIR. Forensic teams have collected 42 exhibits, including car parts and gas cylinder fragments, to determine the nature of explosives used. The NIA has formally taken over the probe as nationwide alerts remain in force. Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.

Gal Gadot honoured with Israel's Genesis Prize for her wartime activismGal Gadot was honoured with Israel's Genesis Prize for her wartime support towards her home country. She has been a vocal advocate demanding the release of hostages, ever since the Israel-Hamas conflict escalated.

Suhana Khan's adorable birthday wish for Aryan is all sibling love, Ananya joinsAryan Khan, son of Shah Rukh and Gauri Khan, marked his 28th birthday on November 12, receiving widespread wishes from sister Suhana Khan and others.

sports.headline: Stokes responds to Botham's criticism over Ashes preps: Not sure what more we can do Ben Stokes has dismissed Ian Botham's criticism over England's Ashes preparations, insisting the team has done everything possible despite a packed schedule. He sounded confident that England will be ready when the series begins.

David Beckham and Gary Neville set to land in India promoting Salford City Manchester United legends David Beckham and Gary Neville will visit India this November to promote their club Salford City. Their trip adds to a star-studded year for Indian football, with Lionel Messi also set to arrive soon.

Bumrah is the toughest to face, hope we don't see him in SA20: Faf du Plessis Faf du Plessis has hailed Jasprit Bumrah as the toughest bowler to face in the world. He also jokingly hoped that he would never get to face him in South Africa's premier T20 competition SA20.

Bangladesh dominate Ireland in Sylhet Test after Mahmudul Hasan Joy 169 BAN vs IRE, 1st Test: Mahmudul Hasan Joy's unbeaten 169 and a record fourth-highest opening stand with Shadman Islam powered Bangladesh to 338 for 1, giving them a 52-run lead over Ireland in the Sylhet Test.

Nitish Reddy released from India Test squad for South Africa series: Sources India all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy has been released from the Test squad ahead of the South Africa series. He will join India A in Rajkot to gain match time after recent injury setbacks.

Rohit Sharma retains spot as No.1 ranked ODI batter, Virat Kohli jumps to fifth Rohit Sharma retained the top spot in the ICC ODI batting rankings with 781 points after a stellar series against Australia, while Virat Kohli bounced back with a gritty 74. Shubman Gill ranked fourth, keeping India's batting dominance intact.

Babar Azam slumps to new low, drops out of ODI rankings top 5 for the first time in 6 years PAK vs SL: Babar Azam has fallen out of the top five of the ODI rankings for the first time in six years after he managed only 74 runs in his last four innings. On Tuesday, Babar scored only 29 runs before Wanindu Hasaranga accounted for his wicket.

Laura Wolvaardt named ICC Player of the Month for October after World Cup heroics South Africa's Laura Wolvaardt and Senuran Muthuswamy have been named ICC Women's and Men's Players of the Month respectively for October. Wolvaardt was the highest run scorer of the Women's World Cup 2025, while Muthuswamy was the Player of the Series in the two-match Test rubber against Pakistan.

South Africa confident of history of our own in India: Head coach Shukri Conrad IND vs SA, 1st Test: In the press conference before the Kolkata Test, South Africa head coach Shukri Conrad said that the Proteas have a potent spin attack and are more than capable of beating India in their upcoming Test series.

Security beefed up for Sri Lanka team after suicide bombing in Islamabad Pakistan has ramped up security for the visiting Sri Lankan cricket team following recent militant attacks, deploying the army and paramilitary forces for protection. PCB chairman and Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi personally assured the visitors of fool-proof safety.

IND vs SA: Dhruv Jurel to replace Nitish Reddy in Kolkata Test, Ten Doeschate confirms India assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate confirmed Dhruv Jurel will play the first Test against South Africa in Kolkata. The wicketkeeper-batter's twin centuries against South Africa A secured his spot, while Nitish Reddy may miss out this week.

Babar Azam slumps to new low, drops out of ODI rankings top 5 for the first time in 6 years PAK vs SL: Babar Azam has fallen out of the top five of the ODI rankings for the first time in six years after he managed only 74 runs in his last four innings. On Tuesday, Babar scored only 29 runs before Wanindu Hasaranga accounted for his wicket.

Laura Wolvaardt named ICC Player of the Month for October after World Cup heroics South Africa's Laura Wolvaardt and Senuran Muthuswamy have been named ICC Women's and Men's Players of the Month respectively for October. Wolvaardt was the highest run scorer of the Women's World Cup 2025, while Muthuswamy was the Player of the Series in the two-match Test rubber against Pakistan.

South Africa confident of history of our own in India: Head coach Shukri Conrad IND vs SA, 1st Test: In the press conference before the Kolkata Test, South Africa head coach Shukri Conrad said that the Proteas have a potent spin attack and are more than capable of beating India in their upcoming Test series.

Security beefed up for Sri Lanka team after suicide bombing in Islamabad Pakistan has ramped up security for the visiting Sri Lankan cricket team following recent militant attacks, deploying the army and paramilitary forces for protection. PCB chairman and Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi personally assured the visitors of fool-proof safety.

IND vs SA: Dhruv Jurel to replace Nitish Reddy in Kolkata Test, Ten Doeschate confirms India assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate confirmed Dhruv Jurel will play the first Test against South Africa in Kolkata. The wicketkeeper-batter's twin centuries against South Africa A secured his spot, while Nitish Reddy may miss out this week.

Superman: Shaheen Afridi in awe of Babar Azam's stunning catch vs Sri LankaPAK vs SL: Shaheen Shah Afridi hailed Babar Azam's stunning one-handed catch in the slips during the first ODI against Sri Lanka, calling it a "Superman" effort. However, Babar's struggles with the bat persisted, as he managed just 29 runs and extended his century drought to 83 innings.

Chelsea's Raheem Sterling and family safe after attempted home break-in: ReportChelsea forward Raheem Sterling and his family escaped unharmed after masked intruders attempted to break into their Berkshire home. The incident, Sterling's second in recent years, occurred on Saturday evening. Police have launched an investigation.

Sourav Ganguly as DC head coach from IPL 2027? Ex-India captain gives a subtle hintSourav Ganguly, who has long served as mentor and Director of Cricket for Delhi Capitals, has hinted at taking up a coaching role with the IPL franchise from the 2027 season. Currently the head coach of Pretoria Capitals, Ganguly remains deeply involved with DC's men's and women's teams.

South Africa hungry to end 15-year wait for a Test win in India, says Keshav MaharajSouth Africa's Keshav Maharaj acknowledged that while the team has managed success across other parts of the subcontinent, winning a Test in India — something they haven't done in 15 years — remains the ultimate challenge and a goal they are determined to achieve.

Ashes 2025: Josh Hazlewood cleared to play after injury scare, Sean Abbott ruled outJosh Hazlewood has been cleared of injury and is set to play the Ashes opener in Perth, while Sean Abbott has been ruled out with a hamstring strain. With Pat Cummins also sidelined, Scott Boland and Mitchell Starc will lead Australia's pace attack.

Jurel rubbishes Pant competition talk: If we both play, even betterDhruv Jurel has brushed aside rivalry talk with Rishabh Pant, saying that the main focus is on the Indian team winning. Jurel has worked as the understudy for Pant in the Indian Test squad, but is making a case for a regular spot with his recent performances.

Matheus Cunha considers Manchester United resurgence as Brazil call-ups reasonMatheus Cunha credits the recent Manchester United resurgence to his Brazil call-ups as the forward hopes to be a regular for the national team ahead of the 2026 World Cup. Cunha has played a big role in United's recent improved performances.

Rohit informs Mumbai of Vijay Hazare availability, no clarity on Kohli: ReportRohit Sharma has reportedly informed the Mumbai Cricket Association that he is ready to play the Vijay Hazare Trophy. However, Virat Kohli's plans remain uncertain at this point in time about being a part of the tournament.

Ashes 2025: Josh Hazlewood cleared to play after injury scare, Sean Abbott ruled outJosh Hazlewood has been cleared of injury and is set to play the Ashes opener in Perth, while Sean Abbott has been ruled out with a hamstring strain. With Pat Cummins also sidelined, Scott Boland and Mitchell Starc will lead Australia's pace attack.

Jurel rubbishes Pant competition talk: If we both play, even betterDhruv Jurel has brushed aside rivalry talk with Rishabh Pant, saying that the main focus is on the Indian team winning. Jurel has worked as the understudy for Pant in the Indian Test squad, but is making a case for a regular spot with his recent performances.

Cunha has played a big role in United's recent improved performances.

Rohit informs Mumbai of Vijay Hazare availability, no clarity on Kohli: ReportRohit Sharma has reportedly informed the Mumbai Cricket Association that he is ready to play the Vijay Hazare Trophy. However, Virat Kohli's plans remain uncertain at this point in time about being a part of the tournament.

FIDE moves against ex-champion Kramnik over Naroditsky, Navara cheating allegationsThe International Chess Federation has formally initiated proceedings against Vladimir Kramnik, citing concerns about recent public allegations and their impact within the chess community.

Jadeja-Samson trade stalls as RR hit overseas quota, fund crunch: ReportThe high-profile Ravindra Jadeja–Sanju Samson trade has reportedly stalled, with Rajasthan Royals facing overseas quota and budget constraints. The deal, which could also involve Sam Curran, may only proceed after the IPL retention deadline on November 15.

Can South Africa's spinners do a New Zealand to take down India in Kolkata?IND vs SA, 1st Test: South Africa have a strong spin attack, and they would fancy their chances when the series opener starts on November 14 at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

IPL 2026 Retentions: Will MI consider releasing Boult? Matthew Hayden respondsMatthew Hayden feels that Mumbai Indians maybe tempted to release Trent Boult and then buy him for a lesser price during the IPL 2026 auction. Boult was key to MI's run to the play-offs last season.

Hazlewood suffers injury scare in Shield game ahead of Ashes opener: ReportAustralia's Test preparations took a hit after Josh Hazlewood and Sean Abbott left the field and didn't return for Day 3 of the Sheffield Shield clash at the SCG. The nature of the injuries of both players is yet to be determined, with the Australian medical team monitoring their conditions.

Asian Games medallist Manju Bala gets five-year doping ban, several others suspendedAsian Games medallist Manju Bala has been handed a five-year ban by NADA after testing positive for banned substances.

Thalapathy's goodbye: What Jadeja's exit would mean for Chennai Super KingsIPL 2026 retention: Ravindra Jadeja has been part of CSK's soul. If the trade to Rajasthan Royals materialises, CSK will lose more than a spin-bowling all-rounder. They will lose a symbol of loyalty and big moments. For CSK, Sanju Samson's arrival would be a promise, and a test of reinvention.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
